thread.title: Daredevil takes leap of faith on 'Scariest Instagram spot on Earth'
thread.title_full: Daredevil takes leap of faith on 'Scariest Instagram spot on Earth'

title: Daredevil takes leap of faith on 'Scariest Instagram spot on Earth'
text:
Daredevil takes leap of faith on 'Scariest Instagram spot on Earth' Last updated 12:16, September 3 2015 Toby Segar/Facebook 
Toby Segar gets ready to perform a death-defying backflip on the edge of a spot once dubbed the 'scariest instagram spot on earth'. 
There are plenty of images floating around the internet of travellers perilously perched on the edge of Norway's infamous Trolltunga cliff, but none are quite as terrifying as Toby Segar's latest Instagram picture. 
The image shows the 21-year-old parkour enthusiast performing a death-defying backflip on the edge of a spot once dubbed the 'scariest instagram spot on earth'. 
The UK free-runner stood just a few inches from the edge of the cliff, which rises an incredible 700 metres above the turquoise-hued lake below, before doing his flip. A photo posted by Toby Segar (@tobycigar) on Jul 31, 2015 at 2:38pm PDT 
And while most people would be terrified of even thinking about such an extreme height, the stunt was performed all in the in the spirit of adventure for Segar, whose parkour exploits have taken him to spectacular spots around the world. 
"Everyone is scared of heights, it just takes time to learn how to deal with that fear rationally." Segar told the Daily Mirror. 
"The scary bit was standing on the very edge of the overhang in preparation for the backflip. Jul 29, 2015 at 12:00pm PDT 
"It might sound crazy, but nothing can go wrong after take-off." 
Trolltunga, also known as 'Trolls Tongue' is regarded as one of the most scenic places in Norway. 
The cliff, which gives incredible views of snow-capped mountains and the jewelled lake below, can be reached by an 8 hour return-hike through sublime mountainous terrain.
